newsitem.title: USA: Guyanor Dachine bulk sample processed.
newsitem.headline: Guyanor Dachine bulk sample processed.

text.p: Guyanor Ressources SA said processing of concentrate collected from about 186 dry metric tonnes of material from a small initial bulk sample collected from ten pits over the known five kilometer strike length of the diamondiferous body in the Dachine permit area has been completed at Broken Hill Proprietary Co Ltd's Minerals Laboratory in Reno, Nev.
Guyanor, which is 68 percent owned by Golden Star Resources Ltd, and BHP agreed in December 1995 to jointly explore the Dachine diamond occurrence. BHP is the project manage.
An insignificant number of stones larger than 1.25 milimeters was recovered from the bulk sample.

Pending review of final results, BHP intends to discontinue funding diamond exploration on the Dachine "B" permit under the Heads of Agreement with Guyanor, the company said. Should BHP elect to terminate the agreement, Guyanor intends to continue diamond exploration in the Dachine area and may seek new joint venture.
